intro: Amblynotopsis heliotropioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
